description: Israel's recent military offensives in Gaza, the West Bank, Lebanon and, together with the US, in Iran, will fuel hatred of the West and a desire for revenge across the Middle East, writes Robert Malley, the lead negotiator of the 2015 Iranian nuclear deal.

headline: Hormuz, the world's oil chokepoint, is under tension
description: A blockade of the strait, through which one-fifth of global oil consumption passes, would have a catastrophic impact on the world economy. Iran, which depends on its oil revenues, has much to lose, as does China, its main customer.

headline: The challenges of a 'Pax Hebraica' in the Middle East
